name: Farringford
overview:
Self catering accommodation and restaurant on the Isle of Wight within the grounds of a spectacular estate, former home of Alfred Lord Tennyson

Holiday Cottages Self Catering Holidays The newly refurbished Holiday Cottages are now available to book online. Set in our beautiful grounds, nearby beaches and woodland walks make a perfect holiday for both you and your dog.

The Restaurant Award Winning food and friendly service The Restaurant, Justin Brown at Farringford, is set within the historic estate of Farringford, former home to Alfred Lord Tennyson. Contemporary surroundings compliment the new modern British menu.

Home of Tennyson Steeped in history the inspiration for poetry Alfred Tennyson (1809-1892), English poet often regarded as the chief representative of the Victorian age in poetry. Tennyson succeeded Wordsworth as Poet Laureate in 1850.

Isle of Wight Blog - Autumn Autumn is often the best season for exploring and the British countryside is never more beautiful than at this time. A characteristic of this brief season is that the light and the colours change
